overview: From 2025-12-01 to 2025-12-02, elizaos/eliza had 2 new PRs (3 merged), 1 new issues, and 5 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Where did packages/docs/ go?
topIssues.author: LinuxIsCool
topIssues.body: There was always packages/docs/ where did it get moved to?

topIssues.title: [Server] Concurrent connection timeouts & add reliability patterns
topIssues.author: linear
topIssues.body:
* **Configure Socket.IO properly** - Add ping/pong intervals, timeouts, transport settings to prevent stale connections
* **Add HTTP server timeouts** - Configure explicit timeouts (30s request, 5s keepalive, 10s headers)
* **Add socket disconnection guards** - Check socket state before/after async DB operations
* **Parallelize DB operations** - Use `Promise.all()` for independent queries
* **Add circuit breaker pattern** - Fail fast when DB is degraded, prevent cascade failures

topPRs.title: refactor(server): optimization and reorganization
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Risks

**Low to Medium**

- Socket.IO configuration changes may affect existing client connections (tested with multiple browsers)
- Code reorganization changes import paths - all imports have been updated and verified

# Background

## What does this PR do?

This PR addresses server performance issues (request timeouts ~30s with multiple users connections) and improves code organization following clean architecture principles.

### Performance Optimizations

1. **Socket.IO Configuration**
   - Configured `pingInterval` (25s) and `pingTimeout` (20s)
   - Set `connectTimeout` (10s)
   - Enforced transport order: `['websocket', 'polling']`

2. **HTTP Server Timeouts**
   - Added `timeout`, `keepAliveTimeout`, `headersTimeout`, `requestTimeout`
   - Prevents hanging connections

3. **Socket Disconnection Guards**
   - Added checks before emitting to sockets
   - Graceful handling of disconnected clients

4. **Parallel Database Operations**
   - Used `Promise.all` for independent DB queries
   - Reduces latency for multi-query endpoints

### Code Reorganization

Restructured root-level files into proper directories:

| Before | After |
|--------|-------|
| `src/bus.ts` | `src/services/message-bus.ts` |
| `src/loader.ts` | `src/services/loader.ts` |
| `src/upload.ts` | `src/utils/upload.ts` |
| `src/types.ts` | `src/types/server.ts` |
| *(new)* | `src/utils/config.ts` |
| *(new)* | `src/services/index.ts` |

- Added `ServerMiddleware` and `ServerConfig` types to `types/server.ts`
- Created barrel exports in `services/index.ts` and updated `utils/index.ts`
- Maintained backward compatibility via re-exports in `src/index.ts`

### Test Fixes

- Fixed invalid UUID usage in integration tests (replaced string casts with `stringToUuid()`)
- Updated import paths for relocated modules

## What kind of change is this?

- Improvements (performance optimizations)
- Refactoring (code reorganization)
- Bug fixes (test UUID issues)

# Documentation changes needed?

No

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

1. [src/index.ts](packages/server/src/index.ts) - Main entry point with Socket.IO and HTTP timeout configs
2. [src/services/](packages/server/src/services/) - Reorganized service files

## Detailed testing steps

1. Run unit tests and integrations tests:
   ```bash
   cd packages/server && bun run test:unit && bun run test:integration
   ```

2. Run build:
   ```bash
   cd packages/server && bun run build
   ```

3. Manual testing:
   - Start server with PostgreSQL
   - Connect multiple browser tabs simultaneously
   - Verify no timeout errors after 30s
   - Test Socket.IO reconnection behavior

topPRs.title: fix(client): improve markdown content spacing
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
This PR includes two fixes for markdown content spacing in the client:

1. Add missing heading and separator spacing to markdown-content
2. Reduce blockquote vertical spacing for more compact display

These changes improve the visual consistency and readability of markdown content rendered in the client.

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Adds consistent styles and spacing for markdown headings, separators, blockquotes, and code (blocks/inline) in `packages/client/src/index.css`.
> 
> - **Client CSS (`packages/client/src/index.css`)**:
>   - **Markdown headings (`h1–h6`)**: add consistent sizes, weights, line-heights, margins, and first-child top-margin removal.
>   - **Separators**: style `hr` with uniform spacing and subtle border.
>   - **Blockquotes**: add compact margins, padding, left border, color, italic text, and tighter paragraph spacing.
>   - **Code styling**:
>     - `pre`: add margins, padding, rounded corners, overflow handling, and background.
>     - `code`: set monospace font and size; add inline code background, padding, and radius.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit a70e5b8f0be7a0b3b8be503df0b23b0566cbb05d. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: fix: markdown spacing compact
topPRs.author: LinuxIsCool
topPRs.body:
# Relates to Fixes excessive vertical spacing in AI-generated markdown responses in the ElizaOS client UI. # Risks **Low Risk** - Only CSS changes affecting markdown content rendering - Uses well-supported CSS features (Chrome 58+, Firefox 37+, Safari 11.1+, Edge 79+) - No breaking changes to functionality - Fully backward compatible - Simple rollback (revert commit) **Affected areas:** - Client UI markdown rendering (packages/client) - AI response display formatting # Background ## What does this PR do? Fixes excessive vertical spacing in AI-generated markdown responses caused by Streamdown's wrapper `
` elements. Uses CSS `display: contents` to collapse wrapper spacing while preserving all content and functionality. **Key improvements:** - Bullet gaps: 24.5px → 2px (-91%) - List item gaps: 30.5px → 8px (-73%) - Header-to-bullets: 28.5px → 4px (-83%) - List-to-paragraph: 145.5px → 16px (-89%) - **Total spacing error eliminated: 178.5px → 0px** ## What kind of change is this? - ✅ Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) - ✅ Improvements (misc. changes to existing features) # Documentation changes needed? - ✅ My changes do not require a change to the project documentation. The changes are internal CSS improvements with no API or configuration changes. # Testing ## Where should a reviewer start? 1. Review the CSS changes in `packages/client/src/index.css` (lines 184-278) 2. Review the component update in `packages/client/src/components/ai-elements/response.tsx` (line 12) 3. Test the visual improvements in the running client ## Detailed testing steps ### Automated Testing - ✅ Playwright browser automation with pixel-perfect measurements - ✅ Computed style verification - ✅ DOM structure inspection - ✅ All spacing measurements achieved targets with 0.0px error ### Manual Testing Instructions 1. Checkout this branch: ```bash git checkout fix/markdown-spacing-compact ``` 2. Install dependencies and start client: ```bash bun install cd packages/client && bun run dev ``` 3. Open browser to client UI (http://localhost:5173) 4. Start a chat with any agent 5. Ask a question that generates nested lists, for example: - "Explain the key features of this system" - "Create a list view with example data showing nested workflow progress" 6. Verify: - ✅ Compact, readable spacing between list items - ✅ Tight spacing (4px) between headers and their following lists - ✅ No overlapping text - ✅ Proper visual hierarchy maintained - ✅ No console errors - ✅ Smooth scrolling works correctly ### Tested Scenarios - ✅ Complex nested lists (numbered and bulleted) - ✅ Mixed content (paragraphs, lists, headings) - ✅ Scrolling and overflow behavior - ✅ Accessibility (screen reader, keyboard navigation) - ✅ No layout breakage in any scenario ## Screenshots ### Before *Excessive spacing between elements, particularly noticeable in nested lists* ### After *Compact, readable spacing matching design targets and Claude web interface* # Technical Details ## Files Changed - `packages/client/src/index.css` (+109 lines) - `packages/client/src/components/ai-elements/response.tsx` (1 line modified) ## Key Technical Approach Uses CSS `display: contents` to make Streamdown's wrapper divs "transparent" to layout: ```css .markdown-content > div { display: contents !important; } ``` This removes wrapper divs from the box tree while preserving DOM structure and semantics, eliminating the spacing contribution from Tailwind's `space-y-4` class. ## Browser Compatibility | Browser | Version | Status | |---------|---------|--------| | Chrome | 58+ (May 2017) | ✅ Supported | | Firefox | 37+ (March 2015) | ✅ Supported | | Safari | 11.1+ (March 2018) | ✅ Supported | | Edge | 79+ (January 2020) | ✅ Supported | Covers >95% of modern browser users. --- **PR Title:** ``` fix(client): Fix excessive spacing in markdown rendered content ``` **Branch details:** - Base branch: `develop` - Compare branch: `fix/markdown-spacing-compact` (from gaiaaiagent/GAIA)
